Pietra et al. studied spontaneously self‐assembled aggregates in a suspension of the CdSe/CdS QRs. 32 The related measurements addressed the magnetizability α
M of a single QR, defined by m = α
M
B, where m is the magnetic dipole moment that is induced by a magnetic field B. Because of demagnetization effects, the magnetizability of a QR was more negative in the transverse direction
α ⊥ M
than in the longitudinal direction
α ∥ M
. The overall response of ordered and oriented QRs to external fields could be calculated from the magnetic susceptibility of the material and the environment. 32
